Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <paia> Verushash algo is no longer a CPU-only... You can mine it with nvidia cards now.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> at a higher power cost and equipment cost. so both are viable and depending on if you have fully paid hardware or not and your electricity cost, CPU or GPU will be better. neither totally dominates the other and I would say a slight edge to CPUs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <paia> few hashrate examples:
```
AMD
Ryzen 5 1600            288 MHs
Ryzen 7 2700X           500 MHs
TR 1950x                1020 MHs

Intel
i7-4770                 130 MHs
i7-8700K                375 MHs
2x Xeon E5-2697v2 48T    530 MHs
2x Xeon E5-2680v4 56T    720 MHs

nVidia
GTX 1050ti              240 MHs
GTX 1060 6GB         400 MHs
GTX 1070                  550 MHs
GTX 1070ti              730 MHs
GTX 1080ti              1100 MHs
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Dochteur> So would it be a good idea to stockpile some available BTCH traded at coinxchange for future staking? Would it be announced at the BTCH main site, once available, or just via discord? What amount of it would make any sense to make reasonable passive income from it before it hits next bull market prices?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> @Dochteur amount is relative term, but I would not recommend you more than few % of your portfolio. As future directions of coin are unclear I consider it as high risk investment. Possible high reward one, but also high risk. I am also buying, but it will be a long way before the final destination. The main argument why team has to do something with the coin? They are holding a big bag (150k coins of dev funds) which should be around 10% (+/- 5%) of realistic circulating supply. At one stage they will have to unload them, so it should motivate a team to do something with that bag.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> @Takoy_Nahal , @Berg , were you recently in contact with Cryptopia about opening BTCH markets? What are Cryptopia's conditions? It's possible they don't know anything about BTCH progress. As there were dozens of forks that days it's also possible they forgot BTCH fork occured. I would imagine they don't follow the progress of unknown forks. People come and go, it's possible they have other people in charge now compared to january/february 2018. They might not know what a big player they are in BTCH sphere. On the other hand, bringing them into the game means massive staker when POS will be activated.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> Consider something within HUSH/BTCH team. It's not impossible they would open BTCH markets for free. But you can also bring another whale along. If we are playing a fair game I would contact them about BTCH progress. Now or when HUSH markets will be back online. But one must notice there is a risk they can stake only and not open BTCH markets. Do your risk management. As I can't predict coin's directions I can't be the one who is making a decisions. I can only make a suggestion or reminder.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> I think this is more a question of Berg or Duke.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JiveBuddha> @halo kitty rules there are no external developers for btch, and no internal marketing. So there is no exchange ambition at the moment. However if external development started to yield significant results (maybe through crypto conditions) there would be incentive for marketing and btch would pick up. Time will tell. Not at the moment.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> @JiveBuddha  Yes, we already get it at the moment there isn't much of anything in HUSH and BTCH. Devs must survive also in bear trend and must do something other beside work on these coins. But that shouldn't be the case for ever. Progress will follow but so will listing fees rise up. It's not an ideal time only for shopping, it's also an ideal time for widespearing to the new areas. And if speaking about Cryptopia, they have at least 500 complete shitcoins under their belt. I don't see a problem to go out with unfinished project as BTCH. Marketing and development are two different species of animals. Even if development is slow or on HODL, marketing can work undisturbed.
